attributes.action: David Cameron to be removed from office for crimes against the UK
attributes.background: This is a call for David Cameron, to either resign or face being removed from office. This man is guilty of human rights atrocities against UK citizens, and he is slowly letting our country get overrun by economic migrants. 558,000 were allowed into the UK last year, 602,000 in 2013.

rejection.details:
This petition is about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for.

The UK Government and Parliament do not have the power to take a Minister to court for human rights abuses. 

If you would like the UK Government or Parliament to investigate or launch a public inquiry on the human rights implications of specific policies, we could accept a petition on that. Alternatively, if you would like a specific law or policy relating to migrants to be changed, we could also accept a petition on that.

You may be interested in the petition for "A vote of no-confidence in the Prime Minster David Cameron. Calais crisis" which can be found at:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/105402.
